author: Mark Orlovsky
comment: The overall look and usability of the watch face is awesome, however with the recent update there was supposed to be a configuration option via phone, however whenever I try to do this it says install settings app...not sure if this is a glitch or what
title: Like it but one flaw

author: Jonathan Flowers
comment: The square face looks nothing like the screenshots provided. The only setting it gives is a "light face" option. I've uninstalled and reinstalled and resynced several times. Nothing like what I paid for, very disappointed. *EDIT* It was somehow overlapped with another app and Wear mushed them together and only recently untangled them. Star rating changed.

reply.author: AQ
reply.content: Hello Jonathan, there is no "light face" options in the settings and the square should look like the round screenshot. Have you mixed up your rating with another watch face?

title: Is this a joke?

author: Jay S Brindle
comment: I'd like to be able to choose more options of what Info is shown and were and have an option of hiding the seconds and more options to keep parts of the fx on/off all the time as well as the random setting it has atm.
title: One of my favourite watch faces but...

author: Amit Khetia
comment: Thank you very much for an awesome watch face.

reply.author: AQ
reply.content: Thank you Amit. Could you please send me a screenshot or a photo to wear@quet.org so I can have an idea of the issue and fix it.

title: Amazing

author: Brian Saunders
comment: Holy Brilliance and endless customization! Super slick and love the glitch effect. Major battery eater though... I'm sure it can be tinkered with in the web of settings somewhere, but this face drained my 360 by 55% in just a little over 2 hours.
title: Beautiful

author: Derek Wilson
comment: How do I enable burn in protection? It also appears that if I turn the ambient ring off, the transitions fail and get stuck. Is there anyway to dim the ambient? Edit.......... The developer emails back quickly and is helpful! Thanks!

reply.author: AQ
reply.content: Hello Derek, the burn-in protection is automatic so you don't have to do anything. I am aware of the transition getting stuck as it happens only when entering in ambient mode and if it's not plugged on the charger, this is why it is disabled by default and I suspect it's an Android Wear bug. Good idea for dimming in ambient, I will add it soon.

title: Awesome. But a few questions

author: Neil Caulfield
comment: This is the best working watch face I have found so far. Most of the fun ones have stopped being supported. This one works flawlessly. Heavily customizable, and customizable from the watch itself. I love the optional glitching animation. Well worth the money!
title: Best watch face so far

author: Isreal Mathew
comment: Great watch face... My only request is for a colour selection interface on the phone... It is too cumbersome via the watch.
title: Brilliant... Could do with a phone UI

author: Kevin Warner
comment: This is the type of fancy watch I wanted, but it can be 5 stars if you could have the ambient digital clock to be much bigger..
title: Best watch face out there

author: CJ Laing
comment: Absolutely love the digital, futuristic look of AQ's watch faces, and this is the one that drew me in first. Highly recommend both this and Digistyle. Dev also has a great sense of humor (Void).

author: Brian Reuss
comment: If abiant display time would stay the same color it would be perfect!
title: Best watch face.

author: Jared Leith
comment: Would be nice to have the settings in the Android Wear app instead of the watch.
title: Great

author: Rich Thompkins
comment: Thanks! Now that I know how to customize it 5 stars!

author: Kristian Serrano
comment: Would love to see settings and a preview available in the Android Wear app. Messing with the watch UI is cumbersome.
title: Love it, but settings are cumbersome

author: Hussain Akram ばし
comment: My only gripe is the face hasn't been updated to the 5.0 API. Once that happens we'll have perfection
title: Almost perfect

author: Seizure Man
comment: This is a fantastic watch face, one of the best in my opinion however I can only give it 4 stars so far because for some reason the animation gets stuck transitioning into ambient mode. I've tried restarting watch, watch is latest firmware and brand new I might add. Lg watch R

reply.author: AQ
reply.content: Agreed concerning the freeze while transitioning into ambient mode, this is why it is disabled by default. At this time, I tried almost everything to fix this issue but come to the conclusion that it's not in my code but on Android Wear side, you will notice when plugged on charger it never freezes.

title: Real glitch

author: Joao Pequenao
comment: I love it and am using it right now. But could get a couple improvements, namely: 1 - Better battery life 2 - Display abbreviated full date, e.g. 15 Jan 2014 3 - Animation controls  But still, this is hands down the best looking face for Android Wear devices. Edit - Installed the updated version 1.1.2 a couple days ago, and it made me upgrade the previous score from 4 to 5 stars. Battery life much improved, controls for the animations and it looks even better. The developer is being very proactive listening to the users and addressing their suggestions, and keeps updating the app. Excellent job!

reply.author: AQ
reply.content: Thank you Joao. It should be better concerning the battery usage since version 1.1.2, and some animation controls have appeared among other options. For displaying the date, I need to find some suitable place but it will be here in few update(s) I guess.

title: Amazing

comment: Awsome update, only issue found was ring does not hide in ambient mode. So far so good. Will observe the battery life. Hope it improves!
title: Still Awsome

author: Jan Newbould
comment: Brilliant display works well emailed developer as have a couple of issues and have concerns about screen burn
title: Great display

author: Jim L
comment: Great watch face! Is there an option to change the thickness of the watch hands? Can we change the hands of the watch separately? And instead of memory can we replace it with  different information like the local weather?

reply.author: AQ
reply.content:
Hello Jim, there is an option to change the thickness of analog watch hands. Long press your watch face screen and click the settings button at bottom, then it's in Clock, Analog, Needle thickness.
We cannot change the hands separately, yet. Maybe in next update(s).
No, at this time you cannot replace memory with different info like local weather.

title: Awesome!

author: SAUD AL-Mesri
comment: One of the best watchfaces, I was going to skip it due to the poor available app description picture but after seeing the video add, I got it with out second thought 💭

author: Anthony Garcia
comment: Really awesome and futuristic. Just needs to show me phone battery and watch battery.
title: Love it

author: Michael McNeil
comment: Issue on the Nexus 5 with changing the color in Android wear. I expect this will be sorted out.  I like the detail on this watch face. Will watch for others from this author.

reply.author: AQ
reply.content: Thank you Michael. Be sure to be connected with your watch when changing the color from the device, otherwise I will investigate this issue and try to fix it for the next update(s).

title: Nice face but a minor glitch

author: LJ Spencer
comment: While I love this watch face, could things I would like to see changed. 1. Better battery optimization. 2. The battery life, and the memory don't seem to update unless I restart the watch. Other than that, great job!!!

reply.author: AQ
reply.content: Thank you LJ! 1. Battery improvement in version 1.1.2 among many other things. 2. In fact they are updated when you leave the ambient mode or each minute in interactive mode mainly to avoid consuming too much battery life on this part.

title: Nice but needs done updates...

author: Benoît `BoD` Lubek
comment: A futuristic / hacker theme, with very cool effects! One of the best watchfaces I've seen, very nicely done. Plus, you get 2 for the price of one ;-)
title: Loved the attention to details!

author: Jonathan Stinebaugh
comment: My only issue with this amazing watch face is it gives my moto 360 omap3 the oh no's but imagine would work flawless on the other watches with qualcom processors
title: Epic looking lots of info

author: Spooky Verkauferin
comment: Wow i am highly impressed by the animations on this watch face and looks great on my new LG G Watch!
title: Great watch face!

author: Paul Elias
comment: Would it be possible to add 12 hour time, multiple colors at once and animation speed control?

reply.author: AQ
reply.content: Thank you Paul. Added 12-hour time, speed control (of ambient transition only at this time) and started to separate in multiple colors in version 1.1.2. Hope you like it!

title: Beautiful

author: Donald Pindel
comment: I like this face a lot.  But could it have multiple colors like the picture.  Different ones per gage or something similar please
title: Multiple colors like the picture please

author: Guus van bolderen
comment: I already saw it on reddit and I wanted it from that moment and now I finally have it
title: Best watch face! Get it now!!!

author: Maxime Dupierreux
comment: It's the watchface I've been looking for!
title: Good job !

author: Nicolas Pomepuy
comment: A lot of  useful data and animations.
title: Really nice

author: Tim Butler
comment: Great animations but since setting it as my watchface on my Sony Smartwatch 3 I've had to charge it twice a day. Gone back to a Sony one and I'm back up to charging it once every 2 days
title: Lovely looking face,

author: Noah LaMarca
comment: This watch face is beautiful and easily customized.
title: Beautiful
